intro: Flueggea senensis, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its pinnate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, milky substance. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in coastal and inland regions. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and has a deep root system for water absorption.
